title: Find Ratios of Consecutive Terms
text: To determine if a sequence is geometric, we find the ratio of the consecutive terms shown.

title: Ratio Between 64 and 16
text: What is the common ratio between 64 and 16? Effectively, what is $$\frac{16}{64}$$?

title: Ratio Between 16 and 4
text: What is the common ratio between 16 and 4? Effectively, what is $$\frac{4}{16}$$?

title: Ratio Between 4 and 1
text: What is the common ratio between 4 and 1? Effectively, what is $$\frac{1}{4}$$?

title: Ratio Between 1 and $$\frac{1}{4}$$
text: What is the common ratio between 1 and $$\frac{1}{4}$$? Effectively, what is $$\frac{\frac{1}{4}}{1}$$?

title: Ratio Between $$\frac{1}{4}$$ and $$\frac{1}{16}$$
text: What is the common ratio between $$\frac{1}{4}$$ and $$\frac{1}{16}$$? Effectively, what is $$\frac{\frac{1}{4}}{\frac{1}{16}}$$?

hintAnswer: Yes, the series is geometric. The common ratio is $$r=\frac{1}{4}$$.
title: Determining Commonality in Ratios
text: Are the ratios between consecutive terms common?
choices: Yes, the series is geometric. The common ratio is $$r=3$$.
Yes, the series is geometric. The common ratio is $$r=4$$.
Yes, the series is geometric. The common ratio is $$r=\frac{1}{4}$$.
No, the series is not geometric.
